slidingpuzzle

Class SlidingPuzzleAbstract<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • slidingpuzzle.SlidingPuzzleAbstract<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type used to store the puzzle.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SlidingPuzzle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SlidingPuzzle2DArray, SlidingPuzzleInt

    public abstract class SlidingPuzzleAbstract<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SlidingPuzzle
    Abstracted implementation of a SlidingPuzzle. This allows us to abstract the way we store the puzzle (like a Long or a 2D Array for example).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int emptyX
      Line of the empty cell.
      protected int emptyY
      Row of the empty cell.
      protected int level
      Level of the current puzzle.
      protected T puzzle
      Puzzle of the object.
      protected int sideSize
      Side size of the object.
      protected int sideSize2
      Squared side size, used to get the maximum value allowed in the puzzle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SlidingPuzzleAbstract(int sideSize)
      Generates a puzzle which is the solution with a given side size.
      SlidingPuzzleAbstract(SlidingPuzzle slidingpuzzle)
      Creates a new SlidingPuzzle from another SlidingPuzzle.
      SlidingPuzzleAbstract(java.lang.String line)
      Imports a puzzle from a given string line which has the level and puzzle values.

    • Method Detail

      • moveLeft

        public SlidingPuzzle moveLeft(boolean edit)
        Description copied from interface: SlidingPuzzle
        Tries to move the empty space to the left. If it succeeds and edit is true, the puzzle object which this method was called on will be edited. If it succeeds and edit is false, a new SlidingPuzzle with the moved space will be returned.
        Specified by:
        moveLeft in interface SlidingPuzzle
        Parameters:
        edit - Whether the object's puzzle needs to be edited or returned as a new SlidingPuzzle.
        Returns:
        Freshly moved SlidingPuzzle or null.

        Parameters:
        edit - Whether the object's puzzle needs to be edited or returned as a new SlidingPuzzle.
        Returns:

      • getAbsolutePosition

        public long getAbsolutePosition(int x,
                                int y)
        Description copied from interface: SlidingPuzzle
        Gets the absolute position of a cell as if the puzzle was represented in a line. If we have a 2x2 puzzle like this: 1 2 3 0 The value 3 is at X = 1, Y = 0 and its absolute position is 2.
        Specified by:
        getAbsolutePosition in interface SlidingPuzzle
        Parameters:
        x - Line of the cell.
        y - Row of the cell.
        Returns:
        Absolute position of the cell.
